3.different between INNER and ORTER Join

// getIndicesByTarget.cpp @ 2018-04-14
#include <stdlib.h>
#include <stdio.h>
class Solution{
    public:
    void getIndicesByTarget(int* num,int len,int tar,int (&indices)[2]){
        int tmp = -1;
        for(int i = 0; i < len; i++){
            if (tmp < 0 && num[i] < tar){
                indices[0] = i;
                tmp = tar - num[i];
            }else if(tmp == num[i]){
                indices[1] = i;
                return;
            }
        }
    }
    //bblu @ 2018-04-20
    void getIndicesByTarget2(int* num,int len,int tar,int (&indices)[2]){
        if ( len < 2) return;
        if (len ==2 && num[0]+num[1]==tar){
            indices[0] = 0;
            indices[1] = 1;
            return;
        }
        
        for(int i = 0; i < len-1; i++){
            int tmp = -1;
            for(int j = i; j < len; j++){
                if (tmp < 0 && num[j] < tar){
                    indices[0] = i + j;
                    tmp = tar - num[j];
                }else if(tmp == num[j]){
                    indices[1] = i + j;
                    return;
                }
            }
        }
    }
};
